intro: Haageocereus pseudomelanostele subsp. turbidus, commonly known as the Turbidus Cereus, is a species of cactus native to northern Mexico. It is a columnar cactus with a ribbed stem and spiny areoles, typical of the Cactaceae family. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, requiring minimal water and full sun exposure. Its growth habit is slow, making it a long-lived plant in its native habitat.
